sen.j: 成生岬（なりゅうみさき）は、京都府舞鶴市に属し、日本海（若狭湾西部）に面する岬。
sen.e: Naryu-misaki Cape belongs to Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, and faces the Japan Sea (western part of Wakasa Bay).
Naryu-misaki Cape belongs to Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, and faces the Japan Sea (western part of Wakasa Bay).
Naryu-misaki Cape belongs to Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, and faces the Japan Sea (western part of Wakasa Bay).
It is located at 35 degrees 36 minutes north latitude, and 135 degrees 28 minutes east longitude.
It is located at 35 degrees 36 minutes north latitude, and 135 degrees 28 minutes east longitude.
It is located at 35 degrees 36 minutes north latitude, and 135 degrees 28 minutes east longitude.

sen.j: 大浦半島北端に位置し、京都府最東北端の地である。
sen.e: Naryu-misaki Cape is located at the northern end of Oura Peninsula, and is a place at the northeastern extremity of Kyoto Prefecture.
Naryu-misaki Cape is located at the northern end of Oura Peninsula, and at the northeastern extremity of Kyoto Prefecture.
Naryu-misaki Cape is located at the northern end of Oura Peninsula, and at the northeastern extremity of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 岬の近辺は、標高100から200mほどの丘陵地帯となっており、先端には成生岬灯台がある。
sen.e: Its surrounding is a hilly district 100 to 200m above sea level, and the Naryuzaki lighthouse is situated on its edge.
It is surrounded by a hilly district 100 to 200m above sea level, with the Naryuzaki lighthouse situated on its edge.
It is surrounded by a hilly district 100 to 200m above sea level, with the Naryuzaki lighthouse situated on its edge.

sen.j: 人をよせつけない断崖の地であり、集落は存在しない。
sen.e: Naryu-misaki Cape is as precipitous as keeping people off, and no settlements exist.
The cliffs of Naryu-misaki Cape keep people away, and no settlements exist.
The cliffs of Naryu-misaki Cape keep people away, and no settlements exist.
sen.cmt: 余分な半角スペースを除去しました。

sen.j: 若狭湾国定公園にも指定されている。
sen.e: The Cape is also designated as Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park.
The Cape is also designated as Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park.
The Cape is also designated as Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park.
